# firewalla-msp_targetlist (Resource)

Target List for domain blocking rules

## Example Usage

```terraform
data "firewalla-msp_boxes" "boxes" {}

locals {
  boxes = { for box in data.firewalla-msp_boxes.boxes.boxes : box.gid => box }
}

resource "firewalla-msp_targetlist" "block_twitter_domains" {
  for_each = local.boxes
  name = "twitter_blocklist"
  owner = each.value.gid
  note = "Block twitter domains"
  list = [
    "abs-0.twimg.com",
    "abs.twimg.com",
    "api.twitter.com",
    "blog.twitter.co",
    "cdn.cms-twdigitalassets.com",
    "developers.twitter.com",
    "fonts.twitter.com",
    "help.twitter.com",
    "mobile.twitter.co",
    "mobile.twitter.co.uk",
    "mobile.twitter.com",
    "mobile.twitter.com.au",
    "pbs.twimg.com",
    "platform.twitter.com",
    "syndication.twitter.com",
    "t.co",
    "twitter.co",
    "twitter.co.uk",
    "twitter.com",
    "twitter.com.au",
    "video.twimg.com",
    "www.twitter.co",
    "www.twitter.co.uk",
    "www.twitter.com",
    "www.twitter.com.au",
    "x.com",
    "pscp.tv",
    "twtrdns.net",
    "twttr.com",
    "twitpic.com",
    "tweetdeck.com",
    "twitter.co",
    "twitterinc.com",
    "twitteroauth.com",
    "twitterstat.us"
  ]
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `list` (List of String) List of URLs to block
- `name` (String) Target List Name
- `owner` (String) GID of Firewall Box or global for MSP

### Optional

- `note` (String) Target List Note

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) Unique identifier
- `last_updated` (String)
